review: Had depo Provera for a whole year before never bled now all of a sudden I have heavy bleeding, what's this all about. About report it to the FDA

Got my first injection in December hoping it would help my bleeding from fibroids and shrink them because my flow was getting heavier. It just made it worse. Bleeding off and on on everyday and taking iron. Hopefully when I get my myomectomy soon it will stop all of this and periods will turn to normal. It's frustrating. Any of you ladies out there going through this I feel you. Do not get the depo provera shot its not worth it. Will not be getting my second injection.

I've been on depo before many years ago. I don't remember bleeding for months on end. I got my first injection Jan 7th of 2022 and I've been spotting, heavy bleeding sometimes, clots and it comes out of nowhere. When I think it's stopped NOPE. I have to wear a tampon every day regardless if I'm bleeding or not. 9 out of 10 times I am. My mood has turned to depression and horrid anxiety. I have acne now that I never had before and I just feel unwell. I WILL NOT BE GETTING A SECOND INJECTION!! Ladies beware it also dries you out down there so sex is uncomfortable and hurts.

I have been taking Depo-Provera for well over 10 years. With no bleeding or periods just spotting every once in a while. I’m currently about 3 weeks away from my next shot. I’ve been going crazy because I have been spotting and slightly bleeding for the last 2 weeks.  I thought something was wrong. Like I missed my last shot or I skipped the one due but I’m right on schedule. I am glad I found these posts, because I feel  they have definitely reformulated the shot and I don’t feel alone in this. I’m sure it is due to ingredient restraints but I would have rather been informed than surprised.

Had depo when I was in high school but stopped; I believe it was due to spotting. Now I’m 28 and needed a reliable BC so I decided to see if my body would react differently to the Depo— I didn’t think it would be worse. I have been bleeding brown and sometimes red blood everyday for over two months. It’s not heavy but the brown blood feels painful…like a burning sensation. My first injection was 11/19/21 and my second was supposed to be between 2/15 & 3/2. I did not get another but am still bleeding on 3/8/22. Will be talking to my doctor about a BC with estrogen to try to reduce the bleeding and cover my contraceptive needs. Been very unhappy with this; like others I got on BC to HAVE safe sex. Also am a smoker, don’t know if that is worsening the bleeding but thought I’d mention.

My last baby was born 22/2/21 and between then and now 7/3/22 I haven’t stopped bleeding. I’m due my 4th shot today and if this one doesn’t change things rapidly then it will be my last. The pain is the worst and bleeding to the point it runs down my legs

My cycle has always been predictable, every 28 days, with 4 days of bleeding, 1-1.5 days I’d consider moderate-heavy. I started Depo late Nov 2021 and bled for 4 weeks straight, light to moderate bleeding. I just had my second injection in Feb 2022, and I’m on my 4th week of bleeding, but this time it’s heavy and I pass a lot of clots, which is definitely not normal for me. I’m not planning on continuing with this birth control because bleeding this long is not normal and can lead to iron anemia. Women should report these abnormal symptoms to their Dr’s.

I've been on Depo-Provera for 7 years and haven't had a period in the last 3 years. However, since 2/14/22, I've been on my period for 19 days straight. I freaked out on the 14th day, messaged my OBGYN and she put me on 1 mg Estradiol (Estrogen) tablets to help "fluff up" my uterine lining. She explained, "Depoprovera thins the lining of the uterus (endometrium) which is why most women don't have periods while on it. Thin lining isn't dangerous. But sometimes if the lining is really thin, then the underlying muscle wall of the uterus bleeds irregularly. So by increasing the estrogen, we can fluff up the lining of the uterus (coat the muscle wall of the uterus) and stop the vaginal bleeding." Bleeding is now very light and hoping it stops tomorrow, as it will be my last pill. If the bleeding continues, I was told to go in for a gyn exam and/or order a pelvic ultrasound to look at my uterus. She also said,  "Weight change and stress can effect your period."

I received the depo shot on December 8 and as of December 22, having heavy (not spotting!!!!!!!) bleeding and really bad cramps. Taking ibuprofen like crazy. Wiped the floor at least 3 times because the bleeding wouldn't stop. For me it did not work at all. I regret having the injection. Made my usual (but pretty bad) menstrual problems so much worse!!!! If only I would have known!!!! Not taking it again.

It's great in that it's low maintenance, and for me I only had the regular side effects for about the first two weeks. But a constant my whole time on depo has been daily bleeding, and since getting the last shot it's been worse to the point where TMI I know but I now get clots. That's been the one con especially as it means I bleed during sex (I'm lucky in that my boyfriend is totally okay with it though and not grossed out at all). Judging by other people's experiences on here, especially those who have been on it for several years, I'd guess they've changed something in the shot itself and now we're all suffering the effects of that

Update on my comment below. Depo didn't work for me. I experienced VERY HEAVY BLEEDING with clots. Our bodies are all different and the medication /dosage required is different. I have now switched to EVRA birth control patch & it is working perfectly for me. I no longer require tranexamic acid. Just glad and grateful to God for these inventions, and that I was able to locate something that works for me. I have read several reports on faliures and complications of Endometrial ablation and Hysterectomy. I would advise ladies to do their research & be very cautious with such risky proceedures even if Doctors suggest it.It's difficult to be patient when you feel like you're under pressure or even bleeding and Anemic. I suggest prayer, calmness & research. Don't rush into procedure or surgery. Removing your uterus or other parts from your body can cause further complications - this has happened to several people. And once you go that route you can't undo your action. Cheers!

We are done having kids. Over 9 years, I have tried several different IUDs and pills, but results were unsatisfactory overall. I came off the pill and took the Depo Provera shot one week ago. My primary goal was to reduce period bleeding and I was prepared to wait through spotting. However, Depo didn't work for me. I experienced VERY HEAVY BLEEDING with clots. I was prescribed tranexamic acid which has reduced the bleeding on day 1. I plan to take 2 pills daily for 8 days , and hopefully the bleeding will stop. Otherwise, I'll keep using tranex to manage symptoms till my 3 months on Depo expire.I will not be taking another Depo  shot. I'm happy to manage my periods with tranexamic acid alone. I didn't try tranex acid while on the pill as I was advised of risk of increased clots. I'm so grateful to God for the invention of tranexamic acid and expect to live my life freely from here on now using it. I also considered ablation or a hysterectomy but decided neither was worth the risk!

It’s been 85 days and I’m still bleeding… got the injections to regulate my heavy periods due to low iron, but having to bleed everyday instead is even worse. I’ll take back those heavy 4 days a month any day
Same as everyone else if I had to know more about it wouldn't have got the shot.
I’ve been on depo 29 years and haven’t had any bleeding until 14 days ago and now it won’t stop. Very glad to see I’m not the only one!

I've been on this shot now for 13 years haven't missed an injection and always get it on day 1 or 2 in my window. I occasionally would get break through bleeding a day or two before my next shot. Nothing serious just inconvenient to light for a tampon too much for a liner type thing. My last shot was in December my window doesn't open for a few weeks and I have had the heaviest period of my life. I started the shot because I got large cysts on my ovaries that were super painful. I hadn't had issues with them or a period in the time I've been on it. Until this time. I don't know what's going on but I hope this isn't the new normal.

I had Depo-Provera for 3 years and took a break restarting in November 2021 big mistake. First 9 weeks fine then started with the brown spotting developing into full blown period that I've had for 5 weeks now. Even had next injection early to try and help nothing helping so far. I'm in agreement somethings changed had zero problems last time. Now no sex, anaemic and grumpy. Definitely not having this again!

So, after I gave birth to my fifth child at age 42, at my postpartum appointment my ob/gyn sold it to me as though I was going spot any way while nursing. I'm angry he didn't tell me I can bleed for 3 months or longer on this injection. Within days I became enraged, I didn't like may newborn at all and could care a less about it (which I have never ever felt until after the shot. I also never felt that way with any of my babies). Not only did I feel enraged, but started spotting within days, lost my sex drive, then went into light bleeding the 2nd week, then 3rd week getting blood clots, now going into my 4th week with huge blood clots. I'm taking iron now. I also have headaches every day. When I looked up reviews with this depo shot, I was crying almost every day and beating myself up for taking this shot. This stupid drug has jacked up my sex life with my husband and I obviously have no desire to have sex on my period with all these blood clots coming out. I will never again take this shot nor recommend it.
I had my last injection of depo 2 months ago and haven’t stopped bleeding. Constant period for 2 months. I can definitely say I will not be getting it again!!

At least  I’m not alone.  Received my Depo shot on September 20th 2021, started bleeding around 10/7/21 and have been bleeding ever since (12/23/21). Worst decision ever, so much regret. Has anyone found any relief? Something has to be done about!

Was given this shot to assist with heavy bleeding during cycle.  Blood tests showed "severe" anemia.  Qualified for a blood transfusion, declined.  Did iron infusions instead.  As a longer term solution, agreed to this DEPO shot.  DO NOT DO IT.  No issue when received the shot on November 10th other than very tender knot in my arm for 36 hours.  Expected to have little to no period, since that was the purpose of the shot.  OPPOSITE EFFECT.  All the improvements experienced in gaining in my hemoglobin levels were lost.  Been bleeding since December 1, it's now the 12th.  Not spotting, bleeding.  There was a day in the cycle so intense it was the worst I have ever experienced.  Mood swings, depression, feeling agitated.  This is all in addition to the exhaustion, fatigue, heart racing, light-headedness, etc that comes with the severe anemia. Please get a blood screening if you are having excessive bleeding.  I am learning how dangerous anemia can be.

I've been using Depo-provera for 3 years, since I gave birth to my 4th child.. I've been bleeding almost everyday. I used to stop bleeding by using contraceptive pills. I decided to stop in August I'm still bleeding.  I'm not going to take it anymore

NEVER EVER TAKE THIS DRUG!!! Please! I started this for bad periods. I had the first one in June, it’s now December 10th and I HAVE NOT STOPPED BLEEDING ONCE. I was also a size 6 before and now I’m a size 12-14 lol, literally no exercise or diet will take the weight off you either. Made me more depressed, tired, and weirdly gave me constant palpitations…acne, breathlessness…worst thing I ever did.

Been bleeding 3 weeks straight now that’s not cool and now after reading all these comments I’m wondering if they gave something else instead of Depo. I’ve been on it 16 years have never experienced this annoyance. Its not even healthy to bleed for over 2 weeks plus where I got my shot had a knot there for about 1 month.  This can’t be life I’m not getting any more shots I don’t trust it if it’s not something else then the Depo is outdated most likely.  I think about it a lot of things we lost access to during covid

I can not believe the amount of women going through the same thing I am. Something has do be wrong here! Many of us used this form of birth control in the past with no problem,  now suddenly in 2021 issues are arising? Something doesn’t seem right. I too am experiencing a constant period. This isn’t normal.

I have been on DEPO for 20 years and this is the second time I have had break through bleeding. This time it's been a good three weeks. The cramps are horrible and over the counter doesn't help. I see the doctor on the 24th. This is not normal they must have changed something in it. I will be asking them

I have been on the depo for 14 years now! I got my first shot right after my C-section with my twins. I bled for 2 months then my period completely disappeared. I have seen nothing until a week ago I started having this brown discharge. It’s been a week and still having it. I certainly hope I am not pregnant as my pregnancy with my twins was horrible and they were premature so I have been afraid to get pregnant and then there is my age!! But seeing that so many people are having this issue I’m hoping it’s a bad batch or something instead being pregnant. Although things like this shouldn’t happen and then so many of us start to experience things that we thought have been gone for many years!! Oh and I’m almost at the end of my injection and due the beginning of December. The makers of this need to see all of this and look into this and try to figure out if there’s a bad batch or Inform us if there have been changes in the ingredients!!
Its worst

I have been on Depo for 8 years and all of a sudden I'm spotting and having cramps. My first thought was cervical cancer because bleeding on depo after so many years is supposed to be rare. Apparently something is going on because there are so many comments of out of the blue periods. With this, I'm still going to my dr but I'm a little bit more at ease seeing all this.  If it's not going to stop my period, I don't want it.  That's the only reason I chose depo. Ok, I won't lie, I'm still a little scared but this is crazy.

I’ve been on depo since I was 16 and I’m 21 now. At first, I was spotting every 3 months, which only lasted for 3 to 4 days at a time. More recently after receiving a shot early October (2021) I’ve started spotting and on and off bleeding consistently. There would be maybe a day or two with nothing and I would think it’s over but suddenly I could be sitting, walking, standing, talking and feel a rush of liquid coming out my Vagina and have to go to the bathroom immediately. Seems like I have to keep tampons on me at all times which sucks.

I've been on DEPO Provera for 11 years, never had a period after my first injection, I woke up this morning and have a full blown period last 3 days brown spotting, and had a severe shock pain in my uterus, very unusual, seeing doctor on Tuesday, I do believe there is something wrong with the medicine now as too many women are experiencing the same thing. I hope my period doesn't last as long as some of these woman.. I hope woman aren't also getting pregnant.. this is crazy and terrifying. I'm glad I never got pregnant but I'm scared of stopping now because of all the horrible reviews.

Had the depo provera injection two times in the past no bleeding no period. I then stopped cause I wanted to have a baby. That took a year from  stopping that I had gotten pregnant. After having my baby they recommend birth control so I decided to get the injection again. Worst decision ever, after two weeks of taking the injection I started to spot for like 9 days straight then heavy bleeding with pelvic pain even worst than the ones I had on a regular period. Been bleeding ever since, I don’t like having my period and to bleed weeks upon weeks none stop is annoying. I can’t have sex with my husband, he says he understands but for how long can this bleeding go on for. Angry at my self for taking this injection.
Got the shot back in August, now October I got my period back on the 20th now knows why and now I am going on day 9 of bleeding and CRAMPING. I will never take this stuff again, ever!

I have been on Depo since September of 2020. First time I received the injection it immediately stopped my cycle and I had not seen one until I received my shot for October 1, 2021 and I have been bleeding since then. It is not heavy but still the cramps! I think I will not be receiving it anymore if the spotting doesn't go away. I definitely believe something has changed with this injection.

I am so glad I found this forum. I was freaking out. Been on depo for about 7 years with no periods. Now I am spotting this brown discharge. Got my last injection 9/21. Seeing that most of us got our injection around the same time and with the same symptoms maybe they changed the formula? I feel better now.

Stay away from this contraception, IT IS UNHEALTHY! Had my first injection on October 1st 2021. Now, 19 days of straight heavy menstrual bleeding. I cannot have sex! Annoyed is an understatement I wish I did further research but as long as I can warn other woman of the effects is one benefit. In Canada this product has had a Settlement Agreement Reached for Class Action against side effects of (bone density mineral loss) osteoporosis, osteopenia and fragility fractures. Persons who have these effects can apply for a claim of compensation for the uncalled side effects. The deadline for submitting a claim is  March 1, 2022. Lastly, avoid this contraception. Stick to non absorbent contraceptives that cannot cause your body harm.

Its crazy and alarming to see so many women having the same problem around the same time with the Depo. I've been on the depo for 3 years no bleeding until my last shot in September it comes out of nowhere at anytime of the day and it's very annoying. My biggest problem with the depo which is more my physician's fault. I had a calcium problem while pregnant with my son but once I got on the depo I was never told about the Depo draining ur calcium, well all my teeth basically crumbled. I had good teeth no probs ever until the depo and they went so quick it was unbelievable. I had no idea what happened it makes me so self conscious and I don't smile or even talk to people. After almost 3 years my doctor just told me about the calcium a couple months ago.

I have been on the Depo-provera a min of two years. I bleed on and off for 30 days straight.  It’s annoying. I’m not going back for my depo I use to take the depo injection many years ago with no issues, now it’s a disaster
I got this injection for the first time in August, since then have been bleeding
Constant spotting and bleeding after the 1st and second jab. Had my 3rd jab today on a period it’s horrendous.

I been on Depo since 2015 March, with no issues, then from January 2021 I went on my periods for over 14 days then it stopped. Then I started spotting during sex till due date. August 2021 went to Gynae he told me the depo makes vaginal thin it is not a big deal the bleeding will eventually disappear. I cannot wait for it to disappear cause it is drowning my marriage. Worst decision ever

For the longest time DEPO was my go to birth control. I loved that I didn't have to remember to take a pill and that I didn't have a period. My only side effect was when coming off of it. I'd get super moody, emotional, and down right irrational at time. I had stopped taking it cause after my youngest was born I had a tubal. I thought that I'd never have to use birth control again. But I was wrong after my tubal I stated experiencing super heavy, long, and irregular periods. When I went to the doctor I was told I could be on the PCOS spectrum. They didn't do any test to confirm. Instead told me I had a few options. Depo, IUD, a pill, or an ablation. After some thought I went with Depo. Past experiences told me I wouldn't have to deal with my super heavy, long, and painful periods any more. Boy was I wrong. 60 days and counting. Contacted the Dr. Office and was told it was the Depo and it could last up to 6months. There is no way I can have a period for 6 months I'm anemic.

This thing is awful....!!! I wish I could turn back time to when I was normal.  I can have 100 kids more but never this injection.  I'm so sick of this. I wish I researched about it before I got it. PlzzZZZZZ never ever take this injection it'll ruin ur life. I'm married and questioning my fertility.  This soooooooo horrible and frustrating.  I took on November 11,2020  and today its September 29 2021 and  I'm still bleeding heavily.  This has ruined my life. Plzzzzz don't  go for this injection. Rather try the pills. This is the worst option ever.  I am using  primrose oil tablets to get over the injection,  it worked so far. It has actually reduced the strength of blood. Do give it a try.

I've been on depo for 15 years and haven’t had bleeding since I started. Love it. I’m 3 weeks away from my next injection and have a full on period. I’m so glad I’m not alone but I’m also really scared. Is there anyway of getting more info? Has anyone here found anything out?

I have been on Depo for over 20 years. Besides the first year, I have had no bleeding until this year. Several times throughout the year with cramping. I mentioned to my doctor, tests were performed and there is no reason to cause it besides Depo. What has changed?

I first had depo 2018 only one shot and came off due to weird orange discharge and leg pain, convinced myself it was cervical cancer at the time.Fast forward to this year Feb 2021, the pill wasn’t working for me so thought I would try the depo again, absolutely fine. Went for my second injection and still no problems at all. HOWEVER my third! 2 days after getting it I started cramping horribly with no bleeding, even went and paid for a private ultrasound as the pain is that bad. Nothing to be seen on there, 1 month later I’m still in pain that’s got worse with weird pink brown bleeding and being investigated by gynaecology for possible cervical cancer. It’s only when my doctor mentioned I had concerns 3 years ago that I’ve put 2 and 2 together that both times were on depo. I’m in the worst pain going down my legs back and pelvis don’t take this. Can’t even get it out my system as only had my third injection last month.
Been on period for 4 months straight now and continue to get migraines.

I have been using this for about 20 years as some of you ladies and am experiencing the same. My periods used to be so heavy and painful it affected my life considerably, mood swings were dramatic. I found Depo fantastic, stopped my periods after the second shot and I never looked back. Past few years I only spot bleed when I was extra stressed, the past 6-9 months I have been spot bleeding more, then last week a full on period, with clots I was out and about at the time, luckily I was with my sister who has sanitary towels. Caught me way off guard, I like most of you experienced cramps. Being a seasoned user of this drug, they have definitely changed something.  I may come off this drug as the only reason I stayed on it was because my periods stopped, I have been single for 13 years now so don't need it for the contraceptive aspect. So glad I found this forum as I was thinking this could be a symptom of cancer and been bit worried. Thanks for sharing your experience.

I’ve been on depo for about 3 years with no issues but the last 3 injections I’ve noticed I’ve been bleeding randomly when in comes 2 months into the injection started with random couple days of light bleeding into it, now coming to my next injection in 2 weeks I’ve been bleeding going on for almost 4 weeks now it slows down for a couple days then boom it’s back full on.  TMI but I’ve never bleed through a tampon before in my life now after 3-4 hours it’s full, today I wake up after it being what I thought was gone for 3 days is back August 25 2021

I am 24 years old and have been on the depo injection since January 2017 and haven’t had a period since then - until now (August 2021). I got scared because I wasn’t sure why I was bleeding. I haven’t had any other side effects from the injection besides this issue.

I had been on the Depo-Provera injection for 10 years but unfortunately I had to stop taking it as I had a DVT in my leg last July which was misdiagnosed for Cellulitis and given antibiotics which then resulted in PE's in both lungs, I ended up in hospital for 4 days, my right ventricle had swollen and was struggling to pump oxygen round my body, I was lucky as I do a lot of fitness and my heart was healthy so recovered within 2 weeks thankfully. So I am not to take the Depo anymore so my last injection was October last year, well what a nightmare  of a time I am having, my breasts are sore for about a week every month, getting frequent headaches, I never know when I am going to bleed as it happens beginning, middle and end of month, luckily I have not been caught short, but as I write this I have been bleeding for 9 days solid and it is not letting up, blood still very red, slighting clotting on day 2 or 3 but coming off Depo-Provera has been such a nightmare for me.

I got pregnant my senior year of high school and gave birth not long after I graduated. I immediately decided to go on the injection because I can’t be responsible enough to remember to take a dang pill every day at the same exact time lol. Anyway I was on it for 9 years and had little to no bleeding. When I did, it was only spotting but it was always random and at inconvenient times, which annoyed me. Didn’t really notice anything else out of the ordinary other than that. In 2020 around June, I decided I was ready to have another child so I told my doctor I wasn’t going to get my next injection scheduled in July 2020. My doctor told me it could take up to 10 months for it to be completely out of my system and for my hormones and whatnot to go back to normal. It’s now been a little over a year, still not pregnant. It’s frustrating and depressing but I keep reminding myself that everyone is different. Mahalo for reading.

I've been getting the DEPO injection since June 2020 and loved it. I was having lighter periods and zero cramping. Figured I'd stick with it thinking my period would be next to nothing. Fast forward to April 2021 and all of a sudden my bleeding is much heavier and ended up lasting a total of two months. My next injection is in September and I've cancelled it due to another six weeks of bleeding (and still going).
180+ days spotting since I stopped Depo....and 12+months spotting while on depo ....= over 555 days of spotting....the product is no longer the same!

I was about 15-16 when put on this birth control, after 2 months things took a turn for the worse afterwards, I had a VERY heavy period almost every day for several months. I would bleed through tampons and pads, I would go to bed with a normal pad on + a nighttime pad over it + a few panty liners and occasionally a super plus tampon and would still bleed thru all of that.  It also came with extreme cramping especially on my lower back to the point where I would break out crying, my emotions were also going crazy. I got in fights a lot more, became angry easier, cried for no reason etc..  it took awhile for my doctor to tell me I should go off of it and see a gyno turns out depo had given me a huge blood clot in my uterus with blood as old as 5 ish months. My gyno said my uterus had expanded to as if iIwere 3 months pregnant because of how much blood was collecting in my uterus. i would not recommend for younger girls !!

I have been taking the Depo-Provera for over 20 years, never had a period until a little over a year ago and now it comes and go's whenever it feels like, I never know when to expect it, i just thought this was normal due to the fact I had been on it so long, but then I went for my last injection a few days ago and I brought this up with my doctor and he told me this was not normal and is quite concerned and is now sending me to have a bunch of tests and freaking me out wondering what could be wrong and now I am reading all these reviews and thinking myself they have changed the product as everyone seems to be having similar issues, time to change to something different I think!

I had my depo-provera injection on 14th June 2021 all was fine for the first few weeks and then 01st July  I started bleeding I had really bad back and belly pains for the first few days I was wearing pads but then I stopped bleeding out so now I'm not having to wear pads but I am still bleeding but only when I go for a wee.  I'm having no other side effects or pains it's now 12th July 2021 I didn't know it would cause you to bleed for a few weeks I'm only use to my periods lasting 3 days at a time also I wasn't due my period when the bleeding started so didn't really expect it

I’ve been on Depo Provera for almost two years and never experienced bad side-effects. No mood swings, weight gain, or periods. As of 2021, all of that changed. In late March, I started bleeding a normal period that lasted over 2 weeks then stopped when I got my next injection. Then in end April-beginning June, I started bleeding again for over a month even after I got my next injection. The bleeding stopped after a week of that last injection. Now it’s beginning of July and I’m bleeding again. Not only that but my body feels weak. I can see myself gaining weight. They definitely altered the drug. Just read an article that Pfizer is stopping the production of Depo Provera so maybe that plays a role. But it’s not okay that they didn’t tell us if they altered the drug. It originally makes our bones weaken, what if the new version is even worse?

I’ve started the depo provera injection fairly recently 24 May 2021. I was on my period which I normally have for seven days but with this injection my period went from normal flow to a dark brown, slow flow which couldn’t fill a pad. To changing halfway in June to a medium heavy flow. I called the doctors in the early stages because when I read the symptoms it said spotting but not heavy flow period. When I spoke to her it was like speaking to someone who doesn’t want to hear you. Not helpful at all. It’s now July I’ve been bleeding for a total of 42 days and counting. Will I get the 2nd injection in August? Nope. Would I recommend it? Nope. It really mucks up your emotions     It has made me cry over stupid things. I had this injection so I could have sex without fear of pregnancy have I been able to have sex no. My advice once again it’s not the one to get

I have taken depo provera injection on 6 March 2021. After that one month was normal and there was light bleeding as expected on period cycle. But from second month bleeding is started and not stopped till now ( 1 July 2021). I am so frustrated and worried that this will cause a big issue.  I am really disappointed. No medicine's are working. I have had to visit of two different doctor's so far. Big NO to using Depo-provera

This is the worst birth control ever. I got the injection in April of this year and have been bleeding and passing large clots daily. This isn’t normal. I will not be getting the second shot. Horrible experience

I got my depo shot Nov 3, 2020 at my 6 week appointment after my son. I don’t want anymore kids right now and had gastric bypass surgery so I’m limited on birth control.  The IUD made me bleed very heavy. On depo preovera I’m always spotting. I’m up to injection 3 and still spot. I have to use the patch to control it. If not I’ll be bleeding with a period always. I’ve been bleeding since I gave birth pretty much. Me and hubby aren’t haven’t it. Going for my next injection in a few days I’m almost a year on depo so I hope it works. I don’t mind a period once a month but not bleeding or spotting everyday. Something isn’t right. I’ve checked my blood work and done an ultrasound so it’s not me.

I got the depo injection on the 7th of November 2020 , and almost started bleeding straight away . I got this injection after having my son and not wanting to fall pregnant again so quick. Never had any issues with my periods until this rotten jag . I have not stopped bleeding since the day after I got this jag (now in June 2021) . It’s been absolutely terrible every day I’m in tears as I just wish it would stop . If anyone knows of any remedy’s etc I have had bloods etc taken doctors don’t know why. There just seems to be no answers

I've found these comments very comforting while I've been on this birth control, so I thought I'd share my own experience in the hope that it will help others.I got this birth control for the first time at around Nov/Dec last year. I had my third injection a month or so ago. I find that I might get a few weeks' blessed relief from spotting/bleeding, but then it starts up again and gets progressively heavier. With the last one, I bled for a week or so after getting it (including passing some quarter-sized clots) then it calmed down for maybe two weeks? And now it's starting again.My bleeding pattern is quite interesting. I find I get a heavy whoosh of bleeding ( with cramps and clots and everything) for maybe an hour each day at around midday, then not much the rest of the time. This hasn't been worth it. The stress and the worry that comes from wondering if the bleeding is normal etc is too much. I'll be asking to go off it and just not have penetrative sex until we're ready to conceive.

I had the depo injection end of Feb I had been having long heavy periods on the mini pill and being 46 there doesn’t seem too many options for contraception.I didn’t have a period in March and thought this is great! Then 24th April I started bleeding and haven’t stopped, I have been bleeding that long my 2nd period has begun as it’s really heavy now like at the beginning of your cycle.What is the point of having contraception when it causes this much bleeding.  Thank goodness I have a patient husband, but it’s getting me down now.I have been prescribed provera for 10 days but day 4 it hasn’t stopped it yet. I am having a hysterscopy next week, has anyone any experiences of this? They may fit a coil if they can as the GP couldn’t seem to be able to.

I have had a dilation and curettage procedure (D&C), done for fibrotic tumors, I tried to go back and get a hysterectomy but my Dr. Wanted to try the depo injection first, I took the injection in first week of April 2021 no period that month, now I have started the first week of May and have not stopped ( it is the 23 May now)!!!! The bleeding is only getting heavier and more clots!!!!! I'm demanding a hysterectomy when I go back, the Dr. Said I may have had an adverse reaction to the injection! You think!

I'm going on month two of having the depo shot, the first time I ever had it I was sixteen it stopped my bleeding entirely I barely had a period for a year after getting off it. This round has been entirely different my first shot I was told to come back when I started my period to receive the shot this time I was just given it and hadn't had a period at all that month. I started out spotting only when I would wipe it did that off and on for like two days now I'm bleeding heavily and passing clots. I'm scared my stomach is cramping badly, so badly I can't sleep what should I do? If I keep passing clots this big I'm going to the hospital I've experienced a miscarriage and I'm almost on that pain level.

Been on Depp injection for over 15 years. Nil issues no period. Got an injection 22 Jan 2021 then started spotting before next injection. I never spotted before. I am in tears!!!! Got this injection first time ever Feb 9th 2021! I have been bleeding since I got the injection!! Like the next day I started bleeding! I’m 29 yrs old no kids never been on birth control and I was making a good decision until this!!! I’m still bleeding!!! I’m at the 3 month mark for it to leave my system! Hoping and praying that this bleeding stops by the end of this month! But I read these reviews and people are at the 5 month mark!!! One at 7!!!!! I had all blood work done, all came back normal I was even given tranexamic acid a blood clotting medicine to stop the bleeding and it did not work!!!!! My life has been awful!! I can’t even think right!! None stop bleeding!!! Don’t do it! I looked up recalls on this Med there is nothing! No solution!!!

I’ve been on depo provera for 20 years and never had any issue. I wouldn’t bleed for 8 months after my last injection. Something has changed with the medication for so many people including myself to have issues bleeding and spotting for weeks and months. I used to swear by depo but wouldn’t advise anyone to take.

I took the depo provera injection on December 31st 2020.At first, I didn't get a period, until early March 2021. Hello ladies I had a baby six weeks ago, and I had a four week appointment where I decided to get back on depo since I’ve had it before. I’ve been bleeding on and off now for 16 days and it’s very annoying! I’m not sure if it’s because I just had a baby and my period is trying to come on or something is seriously wrong. When I was on depo before I had my baby I would spot for a week or two after the first injection and that would be all.

I got the Depo injection in January 2021, started bleeding two weeks later for 15 days. After that, got my next period WHICH WAS NEVER ENDING! That went on for 50 DAYS!!!! Once I thought it was all over (considering the injection should only last 3 months) I then got my period AGAIN! 1 week later, it’s now been 20 days. I honestly can’t handle it anymore. The doctor prescribed me birth control pills but I’m on the fence about taking them. How do I know it will fix my period, he said it will take 2-3 months for the pill to kick in. I would just rather it go naturally. I would not recommend this injection to anyone!

I was on the depo injection for about 2 years with constant bleeding, I went back to the doctors and explained the situation and suggested that I tried the mini pill which I did, this did not help in the end and it seems to me that progesterone only contraception just doesn’t work for me. I cannot have the combined pill due to migraines as they won’t let you have it so it seems as I’m stuck. In total bled for 3 years once I stopped it took about a year for my periods to get to once a month but still not regular :(

Been on this injection for about 5 months, bleeding now for over 4 weeks and heavy and having period pain with it. I now have to go have a scan and be moved onto a coil. Not impressed at all. I have 5 kids under 9 and bleeding like this is not good when you have to run round all day.

Been getting the depo shot for over 5 years now. Never had any side effects,  stopped getting my period the month of my first injection. No breakthrough bleeding. Always get my injection on time. Not sure whats going on but if it continues, will not get my upcoming injection.

I just started taking depo-provera back in November of 2020 bc I have stage 2 endometriosis, only had two injections  so far my second one was Feb 8. After my first injection I had breakthrough bleeding then no periods at all till end of March 2021!!! I had a week of spotting then on Easter cramping and heavier spotting, then more spotting. Then at work a couple weeks ago full blown accident I was not prepared for!!!! Then off and on spotting and 5 days of light period. My next injection is April 26 in a few days and I’m scared to continue but can’t stop because of my endometriosis. I’m also experiencing what I expect is ovulation right after the bleeding stopped but I know that has to be impossible while on this injection now I’m scared could I get preg even tho I’m taking my injections on time!?

Well I got my FIRST and ONLY Depo injection in August 28th, 2020 got my period September 26th, 2020 which ended up being a never ending period and spotting, it’s April 24th, 2021 and I’m still bleeding but it’s not super heavy but some days it can be. My doctor just gave me birth control pills which I’m not taking ,got blood work done on me and I’m just here wanting this to end. I’ve never felt so disgusting with the never ending period, anyone who just had one injection how long did it take for you to stop?

I've been depo since 2017, I switched from NurIstrate because I was bleeding non stop. Using depo stopped the periods all together which was great. But one of the worst side effects was lack of libido. I had no interest in sex for the past 4 years until I got my last injection early April 2021, after that I started being interested to my husband which is good but now 3 weeks later I'm bleeding. I'm not due yet for the next shot until June! This is a nightmare for me! I started contraceptions because of heavy period pains. I have extreme fear of what period pains will do to quality of my life, imagine having to take leave every month to nurse period pains! Please someone tell what did you remove from this drug?

I've been on Depo provera  since 2006.   I stopped a few years back just to see how long it took for my period to return (about 13 months) but its been about 15 years of no periods.  My last injection was 3/4/2021.  4/18/21, I started spotting. A few days later started the heaviest period I've had in years. I'm 5 days in going strong.  No cramps, just a massive acne break out along my chin line and under my chin. Like the large painful pimples,    Which is weird because I normally have pretty clear skin too.  I'm 39 years old and I feel like I'm in high school again.  I do still love depo.  I'm forgetful and would never remember to take a pill.  The IUD terrifies me.  It's also free (under most insurances), super effective (if you get your injections on time) and until now, the lack of period.  Reading all these other posts with similar experiences kind of freaks me out. Has something really changed in the formula of the injection?

It feels so horrible. I got the depo shot on March 16,2021  and two weeks after I started to bleed lightly and haven’t stopped bleeding ever since. Recently I’ve been experiencing nausea, depression, bad headaches & fatigue I don’t know if any of that is normal but it’s honestly terrible, I do NOT recommend.

PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS DRUG!!! WORST MISTAKE I EVER DID.I started this in November 2019, had 3 injections of it. By the 2nd injection I noticed I was spotting quite a lot. I told my doctor and she said that’s normal. I got fed up of it, I asked to change my pill that never helped. Ever since I have had a period everyday. I have been put on iron tablets as it’s made me very anaemic. I got transferred to the hospital to have an abdominal scan to check, the results came back as normal. (Before this scan the doctor prescribed me with some tablets to stop the bleeding....they worked) but after 4 weeks and no pill sorted yet I’m back to square one bleeding every single day. And this all started from November 2019!!!  My periods are that heavy I have to change my pad every hour. It’s so frustrating as my doctors don’t seem to care. Please stay away from this contraceptive!!!! It’s AWFUL!!

Shocked reading some of these newer comments. I have been on the depo for 5 years now and no breakthrough bleeding other than one tiny drop once in a blue moon. Now through my injection is due in 3 weeks I have been experiencing sharp cramping & have been bleeding more frequently & blood clots. Kind of concerned with any changes that they might have made to the depo-provera injection.

Had my son in December 2020. The doctors and my mom convinced me to get the depo injection. My mom swore she loved it and never had issues with it. I wish I had listened to my husband and not gotten it. I did not go back for another injection in March. However I am still bleeding 4 months later. Somedays its light and others days I bleed through everything. I have no appetite and I'm moody. The depo is definitely not for me, wish I hadn't gotten it and recommend that no one else gets it. I want to get pregnant soon but doubt I can because of this bleeding.

Literally the worst decision I could have made as a new mom was getting the Depo-provera injection.  Who invented this stuff? Because while possible spotting sounds like a minor symptom, if I were to tell a man that all he had to do to prevent pregnancy in his partner was to get a shot every three months and then intermittently, or, even worse, continuously, bleed out his butt for months on end, while feeling depressed and enduring headaches, I guarantee you he would not sign up for that.I cannot stress enough to NOT use this form of birth control. Save yourself the trouble and just stop having sex altogether because that’s what you’ll most likely do anyway once you’re on it and bleeding black sludge uncontrollably. I cannot speak more lowly of this BC. I’m sorry if you’re reading this after having already taken it like it did.

Started on Depo-provera Nov. 2020 - No period for close to 40 days - I had just got off period when I went for first injection. I’m hoping this time it will start to get better and periods will cease or become less. I guess I will try injection 3 and see what happens.

I can’t believe how many other reviews I am seeing about how many women loved depo-provera and how recently it has changed since then, I really loved it too years ago how I never had a period, and now I also got it again and been bleeding heavily for 12 days I am also wondering what they have changed in it!? I spotted for a bit first time I got it years ago then it stopped for good after that! I have used Depo provera off and on for over 20 years. When I was younger, I did not have a period at all. I received my first Depo-Provera injection in January of this year (2021) and after one regular period, I haven’t bled at all. Pregnancy tests have been negative but it’s pretty clear that either this drug failed and I’m pregnant, and it’s messing with my test results, or the drug has caused me to experience all these symptoms as side effects- which SUCKS. Whichever way you look a it, it’s an awful, terrible drug- either it’s ineffective or it’s making me feel pregnant.

My primary care doctor recommended depo shot after I complained of heavy periods. Received it last January and thought it was working great, no side effects. I was due for the 2nd shot in March when pandemic hit, but decided not to get it. Started having sharp, painful cramps for a week; then, withdrawal bleeding. Bleeding was HEAVY. By day 7, I was bleeding profusely w/blood clots the size of my hand. Was advised by nurse to go to the ER because she was concerned I may pass out from anemia. At the ER, I was diagnosed with uterine fibroids and given a birth control pill to take for 10 days to stop the bleeding. That night, I bled even more. The bleeding took about a week to stop completely. I really regret getting the depot shot. I later talked to a gyno who said that the shot works great for a small % of women, but most women experience negative side effects (heavy bleeding, extreme weight gain--60 lbs or more, etc.). He said it's not a birth control he recommends.

I regret getting this injection ! I haven’t stopped bleeding since the first time I got the shot in November. Most days I bleed sooooo that my toilet is filled with blood clots . I really can not take this anymore , when will it end !!?

I have been on Depo Provera for 22 years. After my very first injection  22 years ago, I have had zero periods and zero breakthrough bleeding. Zero side effects. Nothing. This has been a blessing. Do not take this medication!! I had my first injection in August of 2020. I didn’t get my period in September and was so excited. I was like Hey, I love this. I sometimes have my period twice a month. Right now I'm 11d ays on my period and still counting. Please I don't recommend this to anyone. It is the worst decision anyone can ever take.

I have been on depo for over a year I went for my injection 20 September I stop bleeding for a week then it was back the last 2 months of bleeding which has been horrible with pains worse than when I had my period. I'm due for another injection 20 December I'm surely not going.
Would not recommend Depo-Provera! Constant bleeding since.

I took Depo-Provera injection many years ago.  I never had a period or spotting from the first shot. I was on it for 6 years no issues other than weight gain. I got the shot again on September 10, 2020. I started bleeding 10 days ago. The cramps are extreme to the point I don't want to get out of bed. Which is not possible,  I have 3 children age 8, 2, and 1 and a stay at home mom. Over the counter medication does not help with pain. There are too many of us experiencing the same things and a lot of us have already taken depo before with no issues.

I started the Depo-Provera injection in Jan 2020 after I had my son in Dec 2019, all was well. I would have a period on the first month, it was long and heavy and then no period or spotting for 2 months. I was quite happy, then my OB had to go for a surgery in July, I was not due till August for the shot, so he said it would be fine to get the shot half a month early. O M G! Wish I didn’t listen to him. My periods have been longer that 15 days, then spotting in between and now a period again! It hasn’t been super heavy but it sure is annoying as anything! I’m due for a shot on Oct 7 2020 and I’m not going on it again! I’m diabetic and already exhausted from that, now this.

I started Depo-Provera in January 2020 I was bleeding for 3 1/2 months ending of Feb through 2 weeks in June It was very light. It would go away and I would have sex and it’s around for like 3 or 5 days and it’s gone. After in June it stopped completely I was so happy like HAPPY HAPPY. I still felt cramps n stuff but no period. So today October 3 I see I’m spotting. So I guess I’m going back to the 3 months bleeding. I would not recommend this only if you want to gain weight. But it really does make sure you don’t have babies because bleeding for so long.

I got the 3 month Depo Provera injection. I experience irregular bleeding (having periods after every 2 weeks and spotting in-between). This occurred for 3 months 'on the depo provera'. I did not go back for another shot cause I switched to copper IUD straight after the 3 months was over. I bled every single day (and not spotting) for nearly 3 months and 2 weeks. I guess it took nearly three months for the shot to wear off for the bleeding to stop completely. Worst Nightmare. Was always tired, hair started to fall, experienced depression, low sex drive.. I discouraged all my friends from taking this.

I feel better knowing I'm not going through this horrible experience of Depo-provera alone. I loved the depo just because I didn't have periods over 5 years using this shot. And now to bleed every day longer than 10 days is very depressing. I would like to know what I can do to make this bleeding stop.  This can't be healthy

I have been on Depo for 10 years without missing a injection. I had no side effects and LOVED not having a period. Something in the drug has obviously been altered because I'm having a period now, and nothing else in my routine has changed. This began around February/March of this year (2020). I've still continued to get the injection, but am questioning what exactly has happened to the drug and why patients have not been informed about any changes to the drug.

I’ve took depo awhile back when I was around 17/18 , I’ve never experienced bleeding like this I recently got the Depo-Provera injection again because I have really horrible periods and extreme cramps, so I decided that I would go back on depo it was the worst thing I ever did. I experienced light spotting when I receive my first injection but I went in for my second around July 2020 and I’m still bleeding non stop and it’s getting very overwhelming because I can’t have  sex with my boyfriend or if I do I have to take a shower first it’s really annoying I don’t recommend it to anyone you’ll  be depressed for months

I had my baby 5 months ago and decided why not get on depo so I won’t get pregnant again. I’ve been bleeding since I left the hospital from giving birth. That was 5 months ago. I’ve been so depressed and weak IDK what to do

I was on depo from 2008-2011 with zero side effects. My periods were gone completely after the first shot and I had no weight gain and minimal mood swings. Fast forward to July 2020, all finished having children I got the shot again. I’ve now been bleeding heavily everyday for three weeks straight. Looking at this review forum makes me think the manufacturer made a change in early 2019 that quite obviously is not working with the majority of women’s menstruation. Who wants to bleed every day for a year?! NO ONE. I WILL NEVER GET THIS SHOT EVER AGAIN. NEVER.
Well I now know why this is a method of birth control....CUZ u won’t stop bleeding enough to be able to have sex!!!! Day 32 bleeding  and counting.

I got my first Depo-provera shot third week of October 2019. It is now June, I've had 4 shots and I’ve bled almost everyday. Sex is painful because progesterone makes me dry and I’m bleeding all the time. Almost 9 months straight of bleeding. I want to stop but I’m trying to wait for the 12 month mark where they said bleeding stops. We will see.

I can't believe all the reviews I'm reading about the shot making you bleed for weeks or even months because now its happening to me. I got the shot for the first time in late April and I started to bleed about 2 and a half weeks ago. And I'm still bleeding. This really sucks. Being on a period everyday is not what I signed up for. I will NOT be getting it again and I just want my period to go back to normal. Would NOT recommend getting this to anyone!

I got the Depo-Provera in January - the only one I had. My heavy bleeding started the very next day  and now 5 and a half months down the line I am still bleeding a heavy period everyday!! Doctors can not work out why or what is going on !!

I started the depo at my 6 weeks check up after my 4th child. I get it every 3 months and have received in total 3 shots so far. I have been bleeding with a light period ever since the day I first got it. It's not as heavy as my usual period but it's enough to have to always wear a pad..

On Depo-provera I have been bleeding 4 weeks straight non stop!! I'm so crampy and wasn't bleeding up until I had the shot!! I had my son 10 weeks ago so decided to try this and what a REGRET!!!!  Is there a bad batch or something?! As I had the shot a few years back and never had this problem

I been on depo-provera for 20 years and was very happy but then when I love to out of state last year I start bleeding. I been bleeding for over 2 years now and I am so depress over this annoyance and my hubby is to. I really want sex but with the blood clots and non-stop bleeding I feel like I'm going crazy. I have tired everything the doctor has giving me bit it just won't stop and I'm sick of it. I'm mad and wish this bleeding just go away so I can try and be happy and work on my depression.  Somebody please help me to stop this bleeding 2 years is too much.

I've been bleeding for over two months straight with massive blood clots. Inside my stomach feels raw and unstable. I spoke to my GYN and she prescribed (in addition) a low dose of birth control pills in which I'm not consistent with taking to try and stop the bleeding. I feel completely miserable and this was my first depo shot in over ten years. I'll never do it again. Lastly, I started having hair loss.

I’ve been on the depo provera shot for over 6 months now and don’t have any complaints. I haven’t had a period since I started it! No cramps, no blood, pretty much the only thing I deal with is the emotional cycle, which I can deal with just fine. When I get the shot, for about a day everything tastes weird. It makes my hip/leg feel weird but I found that walking around and staying rather active the day of the shot helps a bunch! The shot is super quick and doesn’t hurt at all, at least for me with a high pain tolerance. Oh, and I’m not pregnant at all! Me and my boyfriend don’t use any other form of protection and I’ve never even had a pregnancy scare. I used to be on the pill for 3 years and I like this even better.  Overall, everything is going well! I would definitely recommend this form of birth control.

I got on the shot in early Nov 2019, it's now Feb 27th and I have been on a period since. Not a light period but a heavy "blood clot" type one. I'll never get this shot again, and I will not recommend it to anyone.

Well I had last shot on 4th November should have had it re done end of January since then I’ve bled constantly really heavy and big clots massive in fact I've  been the docs today sending me for scan make sure all is ok he did say can take while to get out of body. I’m also anaemic so bloody marvellous no pun intended keep u posted xx

I was using depo for 17 years, switched to Sanaya press a year ago as I can inject myself at home. I didn't have any side effects at all while using depo. Before using depo I had very heavy and painful periods, luckily for me it completely stopped my periods and I have no monthly pain anymore. It does work for some people.

This is my second shot and I am still bleeding like the first one. The shot is supposed to work for 3 months, but for some reason, I get about a month only. After that, I literally have my period every day til I get my next shot. This shot has not been helpful at all. On top of getting my period every day for 2 months, I gain weight like crazy too. Too many cons, I would rather not be on the shot.

I got this shot back in July. I went to the clinic for depo provera and I really thought this was gonna help. I guess I was wrong. Ever since August, I have had irregular bleeding but not a period just spotting and bleeding that happens at random times and I always get blood on my underwear and I don’t want to wear pads every single day. It’s been 7 months now and I’m still having this problem. I know it’s normal to have irregular bleeding but it should have stopped by now. This shot has been no help and I’m always having cramps and bleeding and I’m miserable. And if I stop the shot I’ll bleed for even longer and I really don’t want that. I don’t know what to do to make my periods regular and make my long periods never happen again. I don’t know if I should switch to the IUD cause I’ll probably have more side effects and I’m sick of it. Never should have gotten this shot. Big regret.

I was advised to go on this as I have endo stage one I've been on it 9 months and it's been horrific I bled the first shot for 68 days then I spot constantly which  is so infuriating worst decision I made going on this

I got my depo-provera shot September 27th of 2019 all was good until December 19th I started bleeding. I went in that day got my shot and the bleeding stop. And then January of 2020 came, the week of the 13th. I started bleeding I let it go thinking okay 7 days regular period cool!!. Nope 2 weeks happened then 3 weeks happened. I went to the drs on my 3rd week.. I was prescribed .05 mg of estradiol and to take it for 10 days, was told bleeding should stop around 4-5. Guess what, I'm still bleeding. Uuugh. I don't go back in for my next shot until next month between March 13th-27th. Im thinking about just scheduling another drs appt.

I thought I would get Depo after a pregnancy scare my first jab was given at the beginning of August 2019, I bled from the next day onwards right up to when the next one was due so I decided not to have it, and it’s now mid-feb and I am still bleeding, I have had the occasional day where I think it’s over and it comes right back. In total over 6 months I have had 5 days of non-bleeding! It is almost like a form of torture, I thought it would be out my system by now!! DO NOT HAVE THIS, IT WILL BE THE BIGGEST REGRET OF YOUR LIFE!!
I’ve been taking this for 20 years. It’s been fantastic! No periods, no side effects. Until now. I’ve been spotting for weeks. But I’ve also had to take steroids for arthritis. Probably related.

So I've been on this Depo-Provera shot since I was 16. I’m 18 now. I haven’t bleed on my period for 2 years. This past week I started to spot. Now I'm getting really heavy bleeding that’s bright red. It’s just a little odd that I’ve been on it for 2 years and haven’t bled at all and now all of the sudden I am. I am not sure if this is normal or not.

I have had irregular periods my entire life but when I say Depo has made things even worse I mean it. I got the Depo shot for the first time in January, a week after my period, and at the end of the month I started spotting and cramping as if I was on my period but my body couldn't pass any blood. Now it's a full month, and a couple of weeks, on Depo and I have not stopped cramping or spotting since. Its scary because it really does feel like I'm on my period but I just can't bleed. And when I do bleed it's either dark brown or bright red. I don't think I'll be getting my second shot, not unless it can seriously change my cramping, bleeding and anxiety.

Worst contraceptive ever. I had my first depo shot on the 9th of Jan. Approximately two weeks after I started spotting and then bleeding heavily. I am so mad that my doctor never indicated or told me about any of these side effects. I will not be going back for a second injection. Now, I feel like I am on a permanent menstrual cycle. If any of you ladies are really wanting to do something about this horrible drug, report it to the FDA. And also to Pfizer on their website. I believe this drug needs to be removed from the market. I don't think any woman wants to keep bleeding for months on end at a time.
I’ve received the shot 2 months ago and have not stopped bleeding since. I haven’t been able to have intercourse with my husband because of the bleeding. This birth control is not working out for me

The depo-provera is horrible. Had my son July 2019 and had depo I have been spotting since then, I could hardly tell if I get my period because there is blood everyday. I hope my fellow women get this message before they take this horrible shot.

I started my first Depo-provera shot at the beginning of January and have been bleeding lots of bright red blood for about 2 weeks now. After reading everyone’s reviews about the nightmare not ending even after stopping the injection, I’m really regretting this decision. I’ve had the worst cramps ever and I’m bloated and feel exhausted everyday. Having a full period for 2 weeks is ridiculous and the fact this can last for months is stressing me out. I was very optimistic about trying out another form of birth control since I had issues with the combination pill. My doctor said I would experience just some light spotting until my body adjusted which isn’t accurate. Please avoid this injection at all costs! It isn’t worth the possibility of being stuck with these horrible side effects for months until it’s out of your system and maybe even beyond that! This was the worst mistake ever and not worth it.

I took one depo provera shot in October 2019 and started a period 2 weeks later. Basically that period hasn't stopped till today February 4th 2020. I have tried other hormonal treatments to stop it and all that would happen is that it would stop and start again. Very heavy bleeding with huge clots. It's all very alarming and annoying. All this even though I didn't take the second shot in January. DO NOT TAKE IT!

I received my second Depo provera shot early October after having it once before and while I was 17/18. My mood swings are horrible still, breast tenderness is outrageous I also have had the worst cramping pain (worse than IUD pain).  It was unbearable when I first started ovulating I could not lay flat in bed, had a heating blanket and heating pad on my lower back and abdominal area for a week. I took midol and ibuprofen like the doctors told me and nothing has stopped this. I have clots coming out, they want me to come in again to poke at me. Just super put out and exhausted. I am sleeping up to 10-12 hours a day. It has caused me to have less ambition at my work place too.  I am very active as I am a CNA at the hospital but I bleed through my pants at least 2 times a shift. My acne is horrible around my chin and my stomach is sore from the on/ off  bloating. It brought tears to my eyes finding this page and seeing I am not alone in this.

This is horrible method of contraceptive ever. They must not  continue giving this to patients.  This bleeding won't stop and I don't see a light on end of my tunnel, plus depression which I never had before.  Don't,  don't , please don't ever take this shot!!!

I cannot stress enough about how bad the depo is! I got the shot in Sept. 2019 and am still having horrible side effects. I am so bloated, sore breast and having intense cramping. I've been bleeding non-stop for almost 5 months now. This is so depressing! Along with that I am having extreme mood swings and depression. I never had either of those things before. I wish I could go back in time and never get this shot ever. I only had one shot, I had no idea these horrible side effects would last so long.

Had the shot mid October 2019 and it is now  29 January 2020 and haven’t stopped bleeding since the day after I got it. It started off as spotting for a week then it increasingly got worse and heavier. Went back to the doctors in November and they gave me Tranexamic Acid. That didn’t work at all. I went back again and the doctor gave me primolut that slows down my bleeding for a couple of hours until I have to take my next tablet. I’m tired all the time and always on edge. The dr never told me this was a common side effect or I wouldn’t of taken it considering I’m already iron deficient! Anyone thinking of taking it please don’t!

I’m 45, tubes are tied but was sick of having a period. My mom and sister went through early menopause and here I am. I tried the IUD but Dr could not get it in due to my uterus being tilted. So I opted for the depo shot!  BIG MISTAKE!  Got the shot Dec 18 and today is Jan 25....still bleeding. I will not continue this shot. Dr has called in an estrogen pill, but my luck the pharmacy is out of stock. I’m going to try the Ibuprofen method to manage the bleeding til I get my prescription. Ablation or Hysterectomy will be in my future soon.

I took mine the last week of August 2019 have been bleeding since.  My doctor put me on birth control then they asked me to go test if I have fibroid maybe that’s why am still bleeding (which I don’t have). It’s January 2020 am still bleeding and they said I should wait till February and go do some tests again. I am now skipping placebo pills for the birth control pills to maybe stop the bleeding. I told my doctor that next time tell the person that there will be a chance of long term bleeding not just spotting so we can decide for ourselves if we want the shot or not

Got the shot after my son was born October 2019 , here it is January going on February an I have yet to stop bleeding they gave me birth control pills to stop it and it got worse then they told me to take ibuprofen an it only works if you take it consistently. Worst decision I have ever made I have fibroids and I got the shot on 11/11/2019  to help me with the heavy periods problem so my period was gone until 1/11/2020  I started bleeding and it’s the worst nightmare.  I have even been painful cramps heavy bleeding horrible and continuous blood clots  headaches seriously I’m praying every day for this symptoms Side effects to go away    So I  definitely not recommend  to get the shot it’s been a nightmare for me

I was on depo before from when I around 18 years old to 21 years old and never had a bad experience. So now at 30 I decided to try it again. But wow the mood swings were terrible, so I decided to not get the 2nd injection in December. So 12/18-12/21 I had my first period and thought sweet I’m back to normal. Welp I was wrong cause I bled again the 3-8 HEAVILY EVERYDAY!!Then it stopped and here I am again on the 18th bleeding HEAVY AGAIN!! Hi every one I got the  Depo-provera shot in July 2019 and was spotting till November so upset couldn't have sex and I read something about red raspberry leaf tea and that it made the menstrual bleeding stop. I got my real period a week after and have one week on my period and one week off for the last 7 weeks so I don't drink it anymore. But for the spotting it is working! So PLEASEEE try it everyone it was a life saver. Just drink a heap of raspberry leaf tea as much as u can drink a day.

I was on Depo for a year, and had my last shot om 7th March 19, when I was on depo I would have the occasional bleed but overall it suited me.  However since I have stopped taking it OMGoodness....so I kept a diary.  Injection wears off roughly 12/13 weeks after last injection so 1st week in June. 4 day bleed in July, 3 day bleed in August, 9 day bleed in September, 15 day bleed in October, 5 day bleed in November and get this...... last period started 30th November and today is the 12th January 2020 and I am STILL bleeding!!! Sick of my life!!  I am off to the doctors tomorrow as I cannot handle this anymore 44 days of solid period (no let up) and I am done.  If anyone had told me this might of happened then I would have for sure never ever take this injection.

I have been off depo 9 months, it did what it was supposed to and I didn't get pregnant while on it nor did I have a single period after the 2nd month. However now that I am off the shot and trying to get pregnant I am having a hard time. We have been trying for 4 months and I am having irregular bleeding between periods, missing periods, even 2 in one month after I missed one, and am not even sure I am ovulating because we try almost every day... Not only that but I still have cystic acne from it! My skin has not looked this bad since middle school.  I do NOT recommend this stuff!

I got the depo before I was pregnant worked great no period no issues. I just got it again after having my son... Someone please tell me they've had a normal 3-7 day period after getting it - I've read horror stories about people bleeding for months at a time. I hope that's not me!

Worst contraception ever! Started it in January and was constantly bleeding for 3 months then my period was on and off. Came off it in November and I have not stopped bleeding since.. 2 months later...

I've been on and off this Depo-Provera shot for about 10 years. I got off  and on multiple times no issues..August 2012 I've just had a child. Worst post partum ever. Basically bipolar depression and all the other crud that can come with having no period for 7 years and more..August 3rd 2019 I'm supposed to get my next on NO WAYITS JAN 8TH IM STILL BLEEDINGDON'T GET THIS

I really wish I saw this page before I took the depo :(  I got onto birth control to be  with my boyfriend and for the first month I only had spotting for 3 days and it stopped. Then around the 2nd month, I bled very heavily and passed a huge placenta sized clot. Scared me to death. I had panic attacks and depression for a week. Went to the doctor because I felt so sick I thought there was something seriously wrong with me. They said "its normal", gave me ibuprofen and left me on my way. The bleeding stopped for 4 days and started again. I haven't had sex with my boyfriend in so long and I'm so tired of bleeding. I'm tired, sad, and angry all the time. I can't have sex without there being so much blood. The amount of shame, sadness, and embarrassment I feel is immeasurable. I'm so mad the doctors never told me any of this would happen and now I'm scared it's going to last longer. I'm so tired of crying over this.

I have fibroids and heavy bleeding. I am nearing menopause, so I was hoping I could receive some type of treatment so that I wouldn't have to have a hysterectomy. My doctor recommended the Depo shot. I was on this shot from 16-18 years old I remember bleeding for 16 weeks straight and was in so much pain I had to go to the hospital now I’m 24 and I’ve been trying to get pregnant for the past 4 years with no success is this a side effect? I started taking the Depo shot May 2012 after I gave birth. I had no bleeding for seven years, which was good for me because I didn’t like seeing my period. Omg!!! Why did I choose this shot! I received the shot on 11/ 26/ 19 it is now 12/28/19 and I’m STILL bleeding!!!! Omg I started thinking I had cervical cancer or something! This shot is the worst !! I’m never getting it again!

Well my experience with this depo shot is absolutely horrible! I have heavy menstrual periods so I went to my Dr to get the shot Nov 13, 2019! I have been bleeding  from then til now in Dec 27 2019! THIS BIRTH CONTROL SUCKS. What is the purpose in being on birth control if you're unable to have sex? I have been bleeding non-stop for the past month definitely will NOT be getting the next shot and will be going back on the patch.

This depo-provera  has to be the worst experience of my life I took this medication back in September on the 7th I was perfectly fine up until October 1st the spotting began I thought it was my period but something was off it was dark and minimal it continued for weeks and weeks I started taking ibuprofen to help stop it and it worked I finished a whole bottle of 100 pills and it didn’t stop then the pills have stopped working and the spotting got heavier I went back to planned parent hood and apparently this is normal this is horrible. I’m also so emotional because of this medication I cry at least 3 times a week I just want this nightmare to end

BEWARE! This the worst form of birth control! I got the shot thinking I absolutely would never remember to take the pill but the next few months changed my mind. I bled non stop for 4 months.  I passed huge blood clots the size of tennis balls once a month. I never experienced acne but after that shot I developed huge cystic bumps on my face.  Very very deep and would leave horrible scars on my face. Lastly I developed a beard. About 20 chin hairs on my face. 3 years later I’ve gotten back to my regular face after tons of chemical peels and Microneedling. The best form of birth control in my experience was the pills, the lowest amount of estrogen and you can stop anytime if it doesn't suit you. DO NOT GET THE DEPO PROVERA SHOT!

i recently had a baby & in August, at my 6 week postpartum appointment my ob recommended the Depo shot. All I was told was that I have to get it every three months, & I may have little to no period at all. The first month was okay, the only symptom I had was spotting every once & a while, but I'm on the third month now & I have been bleeding for 15 days & I'm not sure its going to stop. I have to go in to my ob to get another shot in two weeks & I'm not sure what to expect. Nor do I know if I will ever stop bleeding. The only effective thing it has done for me so far has kept me from getting pregnant. But I'm not so sure its worth all of the side effects I'm hearing from others.

How illegal this drug should be right?!? Got the shot in October 2019 didn’t have a period whole month of November. It’s now December  22nd and I’ve been heavily bleeding for 10 days straight. Doctors should tell you the side effects but no they don’t cuz it’s another dollar in their pocket. This is so pathetic. Plz don’t take this shot unless you don’t like sex or like to bleed for the fun of it.

I got the DEPO shot in the beginning of October 2019. Started off with no problems. Two weeks later I started slightly spotting. Then BOOM! I have been on my period (and HEAVY) ever since! I’ve gone through numerous amounts of pads and underwear I’m going crazy! & my hair is falling out! Why don’t doctors tell you this before we get the shot? I don’t recommend this shot !!! I should have done my research, but I let my Dr give me the injection on 11-8-19. So earlier before now I was having this prolonged period and my ex boyfriend suggested I take the shot, the doctor never explained to me that I'll bleed for months when the shot elapses.
